snippet: The nonpartisan office says that lawmakers are focused on the wrong kind of spending and that annual deficits will begin rising in 2016 as baby boomers age.
abstract: Nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office warns that Pres Obama and lawmakers have been cutting the wrong kind of federal spending as they try to avoid the unsustainable buildup of debt that is projected in the coming decades.
lead_paragraph: The nonpartisan office says that lawmakers are focused on the wrong kind of spending and that annual deficits will begin rising in 2016 as baby boomers age.

headline.main: Budget Office Warns That Deficits Will Rise Again Because Cuts Are Misdirected
headline.print_headline: Budget Office Warns That Deficits Will Rise Again Because Cuts Are Misdirected
